Content: While recruiting for this unit and speeding up the relocation program, the government figured it could simultaneously weed out the "disloyal" and thus get a clearer idea of exactly how many agents and Japanese sympathizers it actually had to deal with. The part of it would have been comical if the results were not so grotesque. No self-respecting espionage agent would willingly admit he was disloyal.
Author: Jeanne Wakatsuki Houston & James D. Houston
